subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] I can't assign ah/awe/ox, and the helpful chart made it worse.  Help?
msgSnippet: For me, Thaw and Thought have exactly the same vowel.  I have a Pomeranian dog, Pom for short, the vowel being Ox for me and not the same as Palm, which seems
messageBody:
For me, Thaw and Thought have exactly the same vowel.  I have a Pomeranian dog, Pom for short, the vowel being Ox for me and not the same as Palm, which seems positioned lower and farther forward in the mouth than Pom.

Paige

fctarbox3 wrote:
 

I'm not very good with IPA vowels, but I'm pretty confident Ah is supposed to be the a in father. But when I look at the template Othermale has in the files section, my choice for ah includes palm, lot, thought, and cloth, none of which sound like the a in father to me.

I think for palm I'm the victim of assimilation; my dialect has absorbed the 'lm' so thoroughly into the preceding vowel that it's stuck there forever, I've yet to find a word with that same vowel that wasn't in the "alm" context. You might convince me that palm is just AWE+m, but...

If I say them together long enough, I can make lot and father come out close enough that I can pretend I'm imagining the difference, but I can do the same thing for lot and cloth, and then do the same thing again for cloth and thaw, and I *cannot* do the same thing for thaw and father.

I can travel in a similar direction towards thought, so I end up with a triangle, father-thought- thaw, or minimally paired, pause-paws. It's tempting to think three vowels, three letters, but if Ah is father and Awe is thaw, then thought would have to be ox, and that's just not right, because thought is a diphthong, and ox isn't meant to be.

I think I have on my hands an ox-ah merger, then an awe split, but I had to write this post to work that out, so I may as well post it anyways and then ask, does anyone have any insight?
